body_html: There's a "hipify" step to replace all the CUDA references with HIP/ROCm references in-place: "python tools/amd_build/build_pytorch_amd.py". Also, don't forget to set env var USE_ROCM to 1. After that, you should be able to build using the normal "python setup.py" step.

body: There's a "hipify" step to replace all the CUDA references with HIP/ROCm references in-place: "python tools/amd_build/build_pytorch_amd.py". Also, don't forget to set env var USE_ROCM to 1. After that, you should be able to build using the normal "python setup.py" step.
